member.name: F:Stripe.StripeEvents.InvoiceCreated
member.summary: Occurs whenever a new invoice is created. If you are using webhooks, Stripe will wait one hour after they have all succeeded to attempt to pay the invoice; the only exception here is on the first invoice, which gets created and paid immediately when you subscribe a customer to a plan. If your webhooks do not all respond successfully, Stripe will continue retrying the webhooks every hour and will not attempt to pay the invoice. After 3 days, Stripe will attempt to pay the invoice regardless of whether or not your webhooks have succeeded.

member.name: F:Stripe.StripeEvents.InvoicePaymentFailed
member.summary: Occurs whenever an invoice attempts to be paid, and the payment fails. This can occur either due to a declined payment, or because the customer has no active card. A particular case of note is that if a customer with no active card reaches the end of its free trial, an invoice.payment_failed notification will occur.

member.name: T:Stripe.StripeSource
member.summary: Source objects allow you to accept a variety of payment methods. They represent a customer's payment instrument and can be used with the Stripe API just like a card object: once chargeable, they can be charged, or attached to customers.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSource.Amount
member.summary: Amount associated with the source. This is the amount for which the source will be chargeable once ready. Required for single-use sources.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSource.ClientSecret
member.summary: The client secret of the source. Used for client-side polling using a publishable key.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSource.CodeVerification
member.summary: Information related to the code verification flow. Present if the source is authenticated by a verification code (flow is code_verification).

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSource.Currency
member.summary: The currency associated with the source. This is the currency for which the source will be chargeable once ready. Required for single-use sources.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSource.Customer
member.summary: The customer to which the source is attached, if any.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSource.Flow
member.summary: The authentication flow of the source. Flow is one of redirect, receiver, code_verification, none.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSource.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a source object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the source in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSource.Owner
member.summary: Information about the owner of the payment instrument that may be used or required by particular source types.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSource.Receiver
member.summary: Information related to the receiver flow. Present if the source is a receiver (flow is receiver).

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSource.Redirect
member.summary: Information related to the redirect flow. Present if the source is authenticated by a redirect (flow is redirect).

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSource.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a source. This will appear on your customer’s statement every time you charge the source.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSource.Status
member.summary: The status of the charge, one of canceled, chargeable, consumed, failed, or pending. Only chargeable source objects can be used to create a charge.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSource.Type
member.summary: The type of the source. The type is a payment method, one of card, three_d_secure, giropay, sepa_debit, ideal, sofort, or bancontact.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSource.Usage
member.summary: One of reusable, single-use. Whether this source should be reusable or not. Some source types may or may not be reusable by construction, while other may leave the option at creation. If an incompatible value is passed, an error will be returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeThreeDSecure.AddressLine1Check

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeThreeDSecure.AddressZipCheck

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeThreeDSecure.Authenticated

member.summary: Two-letter ISO code representing the country of the card.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeThreeDSecure.CvcCheck

member.summary: Card funding type. Can be `credit`, `debit`, `prepaid`, or `unknown`.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeCharge.Amount

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeCharge.Currency

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeCharge.CustomerId

member.summary: Hash with information on fraud assessments for the charge. Assessments reported by you have the key user_report and, if set, possible values of safe and fraudulent. Assessments from Stripe have the key stripe_report and, if set, the value fraudulent.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeCharge.InvoiceId

The account (if any) the charge was made on behalf of without triggering an automatic transfer. See the Connect documentation for details.
To populate the OnBehalfOf entity, you need to set ExpandOnBehalfOf to true on your service before invoking a service method.

member.summary: Extra information about a charge. This will appear on your customer’s credit card statement.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeCharge.Status
member.summary: The status of the payment is either succeeded, pending, or failed

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeCharge.TransferId
member.summary: ID of the transfer to the destination account (only applicable if the charge was created using the destination parameter).

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeCharge.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeCustomer.AccountBalance
member.summary: Current balance, if any, being stored on the customer’s account. If negative, the customer has credit to apply to the next invoice. If positive, the customer has an amount owed that will be added to the next invoice. The balance does not refer to any unpaid invoices; it solely takes into account amounts that have yet to be successfully applied to any invoice. This balance is only taken into account for recurring billing purposes (i.e., subscriptions, invoices, invoice items)

member.summary: Amount to capture on the authorization

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCaptureOptions.ApplicationFee
member.summary: A fee in cents that will be applied to the charge and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. To use an application fee, the request must be made on behalf of another account (using StripeRequestOptions available on all service methods), using the Stripe-Account header, an OAuth key, or the destination parameter. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCaptureOptions.Destination
member.summary: ID of an existing, connected stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCaptureOptions.DestinationAmount
member.summary: The amount to transfer to the destination account without creating an Application Fee. Cannot be combined with the parameter. Must be equal to or lesser than the charge amount.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCaptureOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: Email address that will receive an email receipt confirming the transaction.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCaptureOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: An arbitrary string to be displayed on your customer's credit card statement. This may be up to 22 characters. As an example, if your website is RunClub and the item you're charging for is a race ticket, you may want to specify a statement_descriptor of RunClub 5K race ticket. The statement description may not include <>"' characters, and will appear on your customer's statement in capital letters. Non-ASCII characters are automatically stripped. While most banks display this information consistently, some may display it incorrectly or not at all.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to charge $1.00 or 100 to charge ¥100, a 0-decimal currency) representing how much to charge the card. The minimum amount is $0.50 US or equivalent in charge currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: 3-letter ISO code for currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCreateOptions.ApplicationFee
member.summary: A fee in cents that will be applied to the charge and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. To use an application fee, the request must be made on behalf of another account (using StripeRequestOptions available on all service methods), using the Stripe-Account header, an OAuth key, or the destination parameter. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCreateOptions.Capture
member.summary: Whether or not to immediately capture the charge. When false, the charge issues an authorization (or pre-authorization), and will need to be captured later. Uncaptured charges expire in 7 days. For more information, see authorizing charges and settling later.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCreateOptions.Description
member.summary: An arbitrary string which you can attach to a charge object. It is displayed when in the web interface alongside the charge. Note that if you use Stripe to send automatic email receipts to your customers, your receipt emails will include the description of the charge(s) that they are describing.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCreateOptions.Destination
member.summary: ID of an existing, connected stripe account.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCreateOptions.DestinationAmount
member.summary: The amount to transfer to the destination account without creating an Application Fee. Cannot be combined with the parameter. Must be equal to or lesser than the charge amount.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCreateOptions.Level3
member.summary: Extra information about the charge passing level III data to card networks

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCreateOptions.TransferGroup
member.summary: A string that identifies this transaction as part of a group. For details, see Grouping transactions.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCreateOptions.OnBehalfOf
member.summary: The Stripe account ID that these funds are intended for. Automatically set if you use the destination parameter. See the Connect documentation for details.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a charge object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. It's often a good idea to store an email address in metadata for tracking later.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCreateOptions.ReceiptEmail
member.summary: The email address to send this charge's receipt to. The receipt will not be sent until the charge is paid. If this charge is for a customer, the email address specified here will override the customer's email address. Receipts will not be sent for test mode charges. If receipt_email is specified for a charge in live mode, a receipt will be sent regardless of your email settings.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCreateOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for the charge. Helps prevent fraud on charges for physical goods. For more information, see the Charge object documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCreateOptions.CustomerId
member.summary: The ID of an existing customer that will be charged in this request.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: An arbitrary string to be displayed on your customer's credit card statement. This may be up to 22 characters. As an example, if your website is RunClub and the item you're charging for is a race ticket, you may want to specify a statement_descriptor of RunClub 5K race ticket. The statement description may not include <>"' characters, and will appear on your customer's statement in capital letters. Non-ASCII characters are automatically stripped. While most banks display this information consistently, some may display it incorrectly or not at all.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeUpdateOptions.Shipping
member.summary: Shipping information for the charge. Helps prevent fraud on charges for physical goods. For more information, see the Charge object documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeChargeUpdateOptions.TransferGroup

member.summary: Only return orders that have the given status. One of created, paid, fulfilled, or refunded.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeOrderListOptions.StatusTransitions

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeOrderPayOptions.CustomerId
member.summary: The ID of an existing customer that will be charged in this request.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeOrderPayOptions.SourceId
member.summary: A payment source to be charged, such as a credit card. If you also pass a customer ID, the source must be the ID of a source belonging to the customer. Otherwise, if you do not pass a customer ID, the source you provide must either be a token, like the ones returned by Stripe.js.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeOrderPayOptions.ApplicationFee
member.summary: A fee in cents that will be applied to the order and transferred to the application owner's Stripe account. To use an application fee, the request must be made on behalf of another account, using the Stripe-Account header or OAuth key. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeOrderPayOptions.Email
member.summary: The email address of the customer placing the order. If a customer is specified, that customer's email address will be used.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeOrderPayOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an order object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeOrderUpdateOptions.Coupon
member.summary: A coupon code that represents a discount to be applied to this order. Must be one-time duration and in tbe same currency as the order.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeOrderUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an order object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeOrderUpdateOptions.SelectedShippingMethod
member.summary: The shipping method to select for fulfilling this order. If specified, must be one of the ids of a shipping method in the shipping_methods array. If specified, will overwrite the existing selected shipping method, updating items as necessary.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeOrderUpdateOptions.ShippingCarrier
member.summary: The name of the carrier like USPS, UPS, or FedEx. ShippingTrackingNumber must also be set with this property.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeOrderUpdateOptions.ShippingTrackingNumber
member.summary: The tracking number provided by the carrier. ShippingCarrier must also be set with this property.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeOrderUpdateOptions.Status
member.summary: Current order status. One of created, paid, canceled, fulfilled, or returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeProductCreateOptions.Id
member.summary: The identifier for the product. Must be unique. If not provided, an identifier will be randomly generated.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeProductCreateOptions.Type

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeProductSharedOptions.Active

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeProductSharedOptions.Attributes

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeProductSharedOptions.Caption

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeProductSharedOptions.Images

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeProductSharedOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a product object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the product in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeProductSharedOptions.Name

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeProductSharedOptions.PackageDimensions

member.summary: Whether or not the SKU is currently available for purchase. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSkuSharedOptions.Attributes
member.summary: A dictionary of attributes and values for the attributes defined by the product. If, for example, a product’s attributes are ["size", "gender"], a valid SKU has the following dictionary of attributes: {"size": "Medium", "gender": "Unisex"}. This dictionary encoding is handled in a custom parser in DictionaryPlugin.cs

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSkuSharedOptions.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSkuSharedOptions.image

member.summary: The dimensions of this SKU for shipping purposes.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSkuSharedOptions.Product

summary.para: Parameters required for the redirect flow. Required if the source is authenticated by a redirect (flow is redirect).
The URL you provide to redirect the customer back to you after they authenticated their payment. It can use your application URI scheme in the context of a mobile application.

member.summary: One of . Whether this source should be reusable or not. Some source types may or may not be reusable by construction, while other may leave the option at creation. If an incompatible value is passed, an error will be returned.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSourceUpdateOptions.Mandate
member.summary: Information about a mandate possiblity attached to a source object (generally for bank debits) as well as its acceptance status.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSourceUpdateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a source object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the source in a structured format. You can unset individual keys if you POST an empty value for that key. You can clear all keys if you POST an empty value for metadata.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSourceUpdateOptions.Owner
member.summary: Information about the owner of the payment instrument that may be used or required by particular source types.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeListOptions.Limit
member.summary: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100 items.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeListOptions.StartingAfter
member.summary: A cursor for use in pagination. starting_after is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include starting_after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeListOptions.EndingBefore
member.summary: A cursor for use in pagination. ending_before is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_bar, your subsequent call can include ending_before=obj_bar in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSubscriptionListOptions.Status
member.summary: The status of the subscriptions to retrieve. One of or all. Passing in a value of canceled will return all canceled subscriptions, including those belonging to deleted customers. Passing in a value of all will return subscriptions of all statuses.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSubscriptionUpdateOptions.CancelAtPeriodEnd
member.summary: If set, the proration will be calculated as though the subscription was updated at the given time. This can be used to apply exactly the same proration that was previewed with upcoming invoice endpoint. It can also be used to implement custom proration logic, such as prorating by day instead of by second, by providing the time that you wish to use for proration calculations.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSubscriptionUpdateOptions.Items
member.summary: List of subscription items, each with an attached plan.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeSubscriptionUpdateOptions.ProrationDate
member.summary: Boolean indicating whether this subscription should cancel at the end of the current period.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSharedOptions.ApplicationFeePercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal between 0 and 100, with at most two decimal places. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be transferred to the application owner’s Stripe account. The request must be made with an OAuth key in order to set an application fee percentage. For more information, see the application fees documentation.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSharedOptions.Billing
member.summary: One of . When charging automatically, Stripe will attempt to pay this subscription at the end of the cycle using the default source attached to the customer. When sending an invoice, Stripe will email your customer an invoice with payment instructions. Defaults to charge_automatically.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSharedOptions.CouponId
member.summary: The code of the coupon to apply to this subscription. A coupon applied to a subscription will only affect invoices created for that particular subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSharedOptions.DaysUntilDue
member.summary: Number of days a customer has to pay invoices generated by this subscription. Only valid for subscriptions where billing=send_invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSharedOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a subscription object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the subscription in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSharedOptions.Prorate
member.summary: Boolean (default true). Use with a billing_cycle_anchor timestamp to determine whether the customer will be invoiced a prorated amount until the anchor date. If false, the anchor period will be free (similar to a trial).

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSharedOptions.Source
member.summary:
ID of a Token or a Source, as returned by Elements. You must provide a source if the customer does not already have a valid source attached, and you are subscribing the customer to be charged automatically for a plan that is not free. Passing source will create a new source object, make it the customer default source, and delete the old customer default if one exists. If you want to add an additional source, instead use the card creation API to add the card and then the customer update API to set it as the default. Whenever you attach a card to a customer, Stripe will automatically validate the card.
If you use Source, you cannot use SourceCard also.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSharedOptions.SourceCard
member.summary:
instance containing a user’s credit card details. You must provide a source if the customer does not already have a valid source attached, and you are subscribing the customer to be charged automatically for a plan that is not free. Passing source will create a new source object, make it the customer default source, and delete the old customer default if one exists. If you want to add an additional source, instead use the card creation API to add the card and then the customer update API to set it as the default. Whenever you attach a card to a customer, Stripe will automatically validate the card.
If you use SourceCard, you cannot use Source also.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSharedOptions.TaxPercent
member.summary: A non-negative decimal (with at most four decimal places) between 0 and 100. This represents the percentage of the subscription invoice subtotal that will be calculated and added as tax to the final amount each billing period. For example, a plan which charges $10/month with a tax_percent of 20.0 will charge $12 per invoice.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSharedOptions.TrialEnd
member.summary: Date representing the end of the trial period the customer will get before being charged for the first time. Set to true to end the customer’s trial immediately.

member.name: P:Stripe.SubscriptionSharedOptions.TrialFromPlan
member.summary: Boolean. Decide whether to use the default trial on the plan when creating a subscription.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeTopupCreateOptions.Amount
member.summary: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g., 100 cents to top up $1.00 or 100 to top up ¥100, a 0-decimal currency) representing how much to top up your Stripe balance.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeTopupCreateOptions.Currency
member.summary: 3-letter ISO code for currency.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeTopupCreateOptions.Description

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeTopupCreateOptions.Metadata
member.summary: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a Top-up object. It can be useful for storing additional information in a structured format.

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeTopupCreateOptions.SourceId
member.summary: The ID of a source to transfer funds from. For most users, this should be left unspecified which will use the bank account that was set up in the dashboard for the specified currency. In test mode, this can be a test bank token (see Testing Top-ups).

member.name: P:Stripe.StripeTopupCreateOptions.StatementDescriptor
member.summary: Extra information about a top-up for the source’s bank statement. Limited to 15 ASCII characters.
